reviewText:
This is a game that you will find thousands of on mobile markets.

Unfortunately those markets are trying to spill over to the PC.

Fortunately for us, we have reviews and ratings.  This is why we watch out for games that pay for ratings.

This game is a mobile game. It says free but, it is going to cost you a small fortune to be able to play it for any decent amount of time.

Because, like mobile games it has a timer and if you run out of juice" you have to wait to play until your timer is refreshed.

Or...you can pay. So if you see someone with thousands of hours on this game

reviewText:
My Brothers - the Battle has begun!

We will fight the Evil Hordes under the leadership of the greedy Lord Paywall until they are thrown back in theyr small, dreary countries called Androidistan and Yphonia. In those countries they keep millions of poor clueless souls as payslaves.
They tell them, that this is part of a game. But it`s not! It`s just an evil rhythm of click, wait, pay...repeat.
They tell them, that this is the only way games work nowadays.
They tell them, that paying for a game only once isn`t right.

But we know the truth brothers!
We know the games, which wants you to just PLAY them and have a f... good time.
We know the true gamecompanies, which create a game because they have a vision and not because some buissness suit tells them, what is the most profitable way to milk the cow.

So Brothers, sharpen your swords, close your wallets and eat your credit cards!

We shall overcome!

reviewText:
Pros:

Unique gameplay.
Aside Rise of Mythos they cloned try to find another that plays out like this.
Card game, if your into collecting and upgrading cards.
Large multi player battles up to 3v3 in this version.
Cons:

Abandoned development. This game has not has a single content update in 2 years.
in order to compete (Ranked top 10 players) you will have to play 4 hours a day 7 days a week without taking a break or shell out £1,000 on the starter events (they don’t come back).
It’s the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ child of Rise of Mythos. From card variety to events this game is behind on a scale of 10 to 1 or more.
Classes are imbalanced. As is true in every game but as the server you join reaches the point of about 3 – 6 months you will notice there are only 2 consistent classes in top 100.
P2W, see point 2.
I’ve been playing this game since it was released on R2 under the name “Summoner’s Legion” and it hasn’t changed one bit, in years!

The pve aspect is nice I would like to recommend this game to casuals however Ryse of Mythos does everything this game does and then some(a lot, lot more), including no energy dungeon runs for those of you who just want to have fun with your mates and not keen on pvp.

reviewText:
Writing reviews for FTP games on Steam with Pay-To-Win-Faster tendancies is hard so I've been kind of avoiding it.  There has been a model for standard FTP games to gain revenue and this game is no exception to that rule.  I'll try to break the game down as best as I can though and then you can make your own decision whether to give it a go:

Positives:
- The gameplay is actually fun and addictive, I had never played Rise of Mythos or Kings and Legends so a card battle game where you place the card based characters on the battlefield in lines marching against each other is fun as hell and addictive.
- The art is actually really nice so kudos to whoever draws and designs the card characters.
- A full chat system and guild system gives you the ability to make friends to challenge card dungeons and share battle tips.
- The leveling system on cards is interesting - as you play you use the mats you obtain to level up the cards stats using the Alchemist and level up your own weapon and health using the Blacksmith.
- There are a few different classes much like Hearthstone:  Priest, Mage, Rogue.. etc.  So if you've played a CCG like Hearthstone before it plays somewhat similarily.
- PVP 1v1 with rankings and PVP 2v2 are available.  There is also a training mode that you can go in with guildies to practice and hone your skills.

Negatives:
-  Unfortunately, because it is FTP you can Pay To Win Faster.  You will eventually be able to get the same cards even if you don't pay but you will have to play much longer.  This will make doing the daily for PVP to get gold coins a bit more difficult when you haven't sunk real cash and that's a huge turn off for a lot of people.  If you dump some cash into the game you will probably have a few max level rares and legendaries in your deck over the beginning player which will give you an advantage.
-  The launch and first couple of days of this game the Servers were perpetually down in the day so there have been constant black screens. Very bad for US audiences.  I don't want to jinx it but as of 3/27/2016 it has been stable the past few days so this seems to be one negative that has been resolved!
- There have been complaints in the community about people putting money in and not getting gold.  Devs are aware of the issue and have updated that they are working on fixing the problem.

Now comes the hard part - Yes or No.  For me I've been enjoying the actual game and there isn't anything like it on steam so I'll give it a yes.  I'd really love to see a game like this that was fair with a flat fee.   This game is dangerously close to No because of server instability, PTWfaster, etc.

reviewText:
A tough review couse of good sides and bad ones as well.

So lets start with Pro's:

*Simple yet challenging gameplay
*Lots of room 4 strategy (tough rush decks still the best strat)
*Reward system forcing ppl to play in guilds, teams and friends instead of beeing lone wolfs.
*Fun PVP and Stunning Guild vs Guild

And Con's:

*Kind of Pay to win (explenation later)
*Awkward fixed screen size
*Sometimes makes lag spikes 4 no obvious reason

So is this game playable? - Sure! If you like CCG.
Does micro transactions make this game pay to win? - Yes..... kind of..... thing is if you are all about being nr1 in pvp than yes nolifers vs moneybags = moneybags win. Usually top 1-30 are buyers and top 2 guilds are filled with buyers. But as game is kinda forcing you to join guild to compleate all dailys etc than as long as you find or create guild with active members you wont be bored and even more with good teams you can kick ♥♥♥ of buyers as well not often but every time you do that it is a pleasure.
+ teaming up can boost your ranking especialy if u can play when online is relatively low so top 10 isn't impossible with good friends.

Overall game is worth to try. Really important in how good guild your gona join and how active friends u can make as thats like 60% of game here. Sad ofcourse that buyers are so OP most of the time as it ruins a bit of fun in pvp.

reviewText: This game is quite fun. Pretty much a copy of Rise Of Mythos, or Macgika or similar online card games. Its a plants vs zombies board, using hearthstone hero powers, using any standard card format for the deck. Players are able to upgrade each card single handedly a max of 3 times, and buy unlimited number of packs. For that reason this game has become very Pay To Win. Besides that, its enjoyable to play and fun vs a friend or against the computers on story mode. The game however does offer alot of daily rewards, material and gold bonuses so with a grind you can play competitive.

reviewText:
Minimal Content, Maximum Pay to Win

First I really need to correct all these people claiming this is some mobile" game that came over to infect the PC.

This is actually a PC game.  This game was made for PC and Browsers back before Mobile gaming even had moved to Touch Screen Devices at all.

It's both silly and irritating when people are claiming that Mobile is some "Patient 0" type of thing that is infecting PC games.  Pay to Win was invented on PC games.

The Mobile games that do look and work like this one were made to follow in the footsteps of the PC and Browser games created like this.  They didn't make these trashy games that then came to PC
date: they just copied the trashy games that were already on PC and clueless people who had no idea that hundreds of online games existed outside of the few they played think these are coming from Mobile now.\n\nThis very specific game engine and same exact game with very minor changes existed in three different forms on PC and Browsers first and foremost.  I'm sure the clueless people who think this comes from Mobile will really enjoy downvoting this review
recommended: but it doesn't change the fact that this is from a PC and Browser game.\n\nOn to the game itself - other than the facts of where it comes from that people are getting wrong
hoursPlayed: they are very right about what kind of game it is.  This is general pay to win with timers
voteText: VIP levels
helpfulPercent: and things like buying card draws that greatly affect your strength (but are usually weak unless you spend a great amount of money).  This game was created at the height of Pay to Win on "Free to Play" Browser games.  While you may get a fresh new server here
votesHelpful: it's still the same pay to win formula.\n\nYou can have some fun with free but it's more about buying cards than any strategy placing them.  The game will trick you at first and make it seem like it has to do with strategy
votesTotal:
but it changes to be based on having high tier pay cards later on.

This specific version here is even worse than the old Browser versions as it gives you a nice big black screen instead of launching a lot of the time.  You should probably consider yourself lucky if you're getting that black screen - you just had some time and frustration saved.

*If* you are a Whale however that likes Pay to Win and spends thousands of dollars on them (there are many many of those people out there) - then yes I highly suggest this game to you and you'll probably absolutely love the system here.  As for the general player I'd not really suggest it and that's why I'm having to downvote
votesFunny: but if you are a whale go right ahead and enjoy the game.  It's definitely made for you suckers who pay out the nose in order to come out on top."

reviewText:
After having given this game as much time as I can to try 'get into it' I have discovered a few things. (bear in mind the hours shown are 'Steam' hours and are mostly me logging in, doing 45seconds of stuff and tabbing out to play a different game)

Yes, it is pay to win. You can start a new account, jump the mandatory newbie stuff, drop money on the game and literally buy your way to pvp victory.

However.

They've made the paywall as hideously scummy as possible. If you want to pay real money to buy stuff, YOU the player do not choose how much you pay. There are VIP 'levels' each on is locked by an amount of Real World $$ you spend.
Examples...

You would like to automatically use gold to purchase missing components to upgrade your weapons in the blacksmith. Even if you have saved up 1,000 gold (~$7.50) you cannot use that feature unless you have first paid $20.00 to achieve VIP 3 status.

You would like to buy missing dust/gems to enchant a card (you're missing 2 dust from the 1,800 cost?) excellent, you need to have first already have paid $70.00 for VIP 5 status or you could just re-do the level 1 tutorial mission and get 5 dust for free.

Would you like to buy some in game currency? (silver coins)  Sure thing, that'll cost 240 gold to buy 10,000 silver (so about $2.40). Okay, that's the most basic thing of ALL pay 2 play games. As long as you spend $10.00 you will gain the right to purchase in game currency.

This game is not Pay to Play. It's Pay to have the ability to Pay to Pay to Play.

The free part of this game is not bad, the cards are fun (and totally unbalanced, everyone uses exactly the same core cards) The system of upgrading and boosting cards is really good, but very slow, unless you spend ~$70-90 to unlock the ability to purchase the upgrades flat out.
The battles are good and move well.

But... It's a flash game in a flash window. No feedback if there is server maintenance or if they're down. Randomly disconnects you (on the plus, when you reconnect you don't 'lose' your battle, you just rejoin)

Don't get this game unless you want a slow paced Collectible Card Game.


{{ORIGINAL REVIEW ON RELEASE : A half made Flash game, they haven't even bothered to take out the default comments in the flash config files.

But if you need a blank black window to run Steam Overlay in, this is the app for you.
[EDIT] They resolved the black screen issue.

Then while I was trying to give it a fair shake of the stick, they announced a server shutdown, (scrolling text along a tiny bar at the top) and before the text We regret ...." the servers disconnected and booted players.

I'm really trying to give this game a fair go
date: but so far it's a poorly coded Flash Air game that would be better suited to Kongregate or Android Google store
recommended: where games do not pass quality assurance.}}"

reviewText:
Well, I know the game from R2Games, where I reached max level, so I guess my review will be usefull (I migrate because R2 no longer supports this game).

So, first look at the game itself (how it works). There are four classes with different advantages and 6 weapons each. You need to tweak out, which cards are good for both your class and its weapon (I recommend priest for newbies). You will find new cards around every corner in the begginings. All have their tactical use and offers fun for a long time. You can enjoy team battles, dungeons, arena, 2vs2 arena and probably more in the future.

It means, it is generally common card game with something new and better and something old. It requires trying to find out, whether this common style fits u.

It has some negative sides as well. I won't judge, whether it is p2win or not. I will just tell facts:
- there are many events, which offer you to gain gold currency
- there is all fusing material available and easy to harvest
- people who are VIP (at least 1, it is permanent and costs a bit) will gain double rewards for daily login
- people who are VIP may get 2 unique cards
- rewards for reaching bigger grades of VIP are strong cards, but are fully available to anyone
- VIP can buy unique clothing in the shop, which gives them 2 more HP (clothing bought for free currency give 3 HP in total, so it is much better)
- there are many events allowing you to get extra cards for free
- I was strong enough to beat anyone on the servers of R2 (and servers of developer itself are not going to be different)
- VIP people can Blitz campaigns, which makes them replay the level (or dungeon) just for stamina and get rewards. You will get better rewards if you finish achievements, which is not possible through blitzing.
- stamina prevents you to play whole night. It will seem awfull in the beginning as you have small stamina poll, but you will have stamina enough later (it will take more than day to refill it on the latest level). Everyone can buy first extra 50 stamina for gold. VIP can buy it more times, but for extra times, which does not worth at all.

I reckon developers have their own way to gain money to sustain servers and develop games, but does no give you a huge advantage. If you pay these 5 dollars for VIP1, you will get enough of everything in my opinion. If you don't, you can become powerfull player as well, but it will take a time.




I will change review if something goes different and won't be the same as I expected and have known. But, these are my experiences.

reviewText:
This seems to be Mobile or Browser Game. Some people dislike them, but i don't. I think more needs to come to steam. Note: This review might change once i play more.

Pros+
Great visuals
Very nice beautiful Music
Runs at 25-30fps, which is smooth with no lag
You can earn rewards just like any other browser game
Nice feature where you have to select cards to battle
Short Tutorial
No Auto play like some browser games. Well there's auto play from the start of the game, but once you get passed that, its on you.
Lots of characters
Classes are nice
Not too diffuclty
Fast pace fun matches
PVE Single player

Cons-
Auto play at the start, forced to do it
No Fullscreen options. I also tried changing some data in the XML file, no luck. You're forced to play in a window.
No character creation
Expensive prices for items as usual in a game like this
This game isn't avaible as a offline client, which IMO would of been better , sold at a decent price.

Bottom line: Yes i recommed this game, its easy to play and despite it not being able to go into fullscreen mode, its still fun. I also think you can earn gold, but I'm not sure yet. Its a low budget free2play browser game , enjoy it and have fun. I never got a black screen error like some people btw.

reviewText:
I have mixed feelings for this game. On one hand, I know that the energy barrier is going to become a big enough of an issue that I'll simply lose interest. On the other, it's actually a pretty well designed and entertaining game for the moment.

If you want a free to play game with a pretty good PvE experience, Age of Magic is quite satisfactory on the PvE front. There's a few options to choose from including the campaign (which amounts to basically 'fight this. Now fight this. Now fight this.'), dungeons (quite enjoyable with bots or other players as allies), and. . more fighting to farm for stuff.

It plays like a lane defense game with cards. You have 2-3 lanes that you play cards into, then they walk toward the opponent with little to no consideration of their survival while smashing everything along the way. Special abilities (all of which are passive effects) can alter how a unit works. Legendary cards are more eccentric and have game changing effects, but are fairly difficult to get from the get go. You get one free legendary after playing for a day or two, and you have to scrap together shard pieces of the others to get them. Unless, of course, you buy packs.

Once again, the energy restriction is actually more of a deterrent than the farming itself. While this game doesn't rob you of your energy as readily as some have in the past, you'll still run out, and you'll still have to go off and find something to do while it's regenerating. But, this is a game that's best in short bursts anyhow, more of a time waster for a lunch break than a game to dedicate your time to.

If you want to join along for the PvP, well. . You're probably going to be pulling your hair out. Be prepared to have a cadre of basic cards and go up against people with a fairly well rounded card collection. Including legendaries. Lots, and lots, of legendaries. So unless you want to dump lots of money into the game for the sake of having cards to PvP with, I highly suggest playing something else. The PvE does provide a steady stream of general purpose cards, but if you're playing for free, you're going to have to get the cheese grater ready for your face, 'cause you're going to be grinding 'til the break of dawn for the interesting cards.

For what it's worth, it was an enjoyable waste of my time, for what little I experienced it. I played as a free to play player for seven hours and had a good time. Perhaps others will play more in the long term than I have.

Important!
-----------
Something to bear in mind is class selection at the beginning. Do research on the classes before you choose one, because that's the class you're going to have for a while. You have to unlock the others with in game currency with a substantial increase in cost with each class unlocked.  This is just silly, and is really the only thing I absolutely find irritating about the game. It'd be easier to know which one you want to play before you even begin, to save yourself the time and trouble.

I started as a priest and unlocked ranger roughly four hours in. The next unlock doubled in cost. Bear in mind that I used many of the newbie bonuses for achievements and the like to unlock ranger, so all that extra currency is now gone.

I didn't like ranger. Oh well.

Follow Up
--------------
As I had suspected, the energy barrier is impactful in a very negative way. The cost for actions scale upward the further in you go, making the fact you have more energy completely negligable. Also, I see no point in spending money on a game that not only restricts classes behind an in game currency barrier, but also may lock the money I spent behind an ever increasingly tight energy barrier. While my initial thoughts are still valid for those looking for a casual experience, I'm afraid I have to withdraw my recommendation for this game. As long as the energy barrier remains, it will be another money grabbing mobile game not worthy of an average gamer's time.

reviewText:
This is part review and part beginner tips to have a more enjoyable experience in the game. I've played the R2game version for several years and have 3 high level accounts and our guild used to compete for top 1 spot in pvp until lack of updates killed the population.

The game will eventually let you be competitive (which cards are locked via paywall depends on publisher; there are several, but while free gold is less available here and costs are higher than R2, you can buy racial packs without being VIP so that's a plus - also R2game version is pretty much dead and unsupported). Just do your daily devotion, join an active guild, do the hot events and learn which quests/dungeons to farm and you'll be fine.

Now for new players, rushing is about the easiest way to go about it. Focus on getting Lupes (1-2 mana), Lyons (3-5 mana), Aves (backstabbers for defense, 2-4 mana) and whatever class cards you have. Add in extra 1-2 mana monsters to round off your deck. I suggest starting as a Ranger or Priest. Rangers can directly damage the enemy player and priests can heal themselves. These two classes are also fairly competent in PvP.

Later on you can branch out to other decks and builds but make sure you have your rush deck handy for minimal headaches while going through the early parts of the game.

reviewText:
I usually dont review games, but this is a game i have played alot through the ages and its many different versions. So im gonna give it a go and give you my thoughts. And also explain why i wont recommend this game to anyone at the moment.

The gameplay is really fun and addictive, nothing to complain about here. You construct a deck and fight others or NPCs. Together in dungeons or alone in the Campaign. Simple right?
But the problem arises the 1v1 arena. At a low level (arena ranking based) balance issues will occur due to high level differences and straight up Deck power. But at higher levels im beginning to see a very big difference in HOW the game is played.

Right now there are two major types of decks played:
Rush decks, and control decks. This does not bother me at all, because games like these always tend to have some strategies that are better thah others. But here comes the reason why this game is not any fun to play, brace yourselves!

THE DEVS DONT CARE.
Thats right, in other games cards are updated, classes are balanced and tweaked, new cards are added. But in this game? Nope! Nothing of the sort. You heard me right. Since i started playing this game, not ONE change has been made to the
-Classes (No nerfs, no buffs.)
-Cards (Like in general, nothing new, no balances, nothing.)
-Maps (Like sizewise lanewise etc.)
-The Campaign (No new Campaigns.)
-The Dungeons (No new dungeons.)

Right about now you must ask yourself, what are the devs doing then!?
Well right now the only 
ew features" i've seen are some events. And mostly centered around the pay to win part of the game. And that is why i will not recommend this game at the time. I will of course change my review if the devs get of their asses and create some new content. But in my past experience with these games. Not going to happen.

TL;DR:
Devs are money hungry
recommended: 1v1 players (The only content which is fun at the moment is 1v1.) are one trick ponies
hoursPlayed:
and no new cards are coming out to counter the one trick.

I rate the game
2/10"
voteText: June 1
